result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan C Medina in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense requests more time to review case.  State does not object.  Court grants request for adjournment and vacated jury trial date set for 8-08-22.  Court set new final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in Room 503 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Ryan C Medina in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley. Parties appeared via zoom.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are discussing resolution.  The defense is requesting the final pretrial adjourned in Br 16.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  mn  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 5.11.2022

Defendant Ryan C Medina in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel advises parties that they have received discovery materials. Court sets 06/03/2022 deadline for filing any motions, and further sets Jury Status Hearing, Final Pre-Trial, and Jury trial dates. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision report 04/04/2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision report 04-01-2022

Defendant Ryan C Medina in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant previously posted $4,000 cash bail. Court orders that $500.00 cash remain on deposit and the rest be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision LEVEL 4. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Ryan C Medina in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
